casebody.data:
Sheri BIERMAN, Appellant,
v.
Kimmie VIOLETTE, Respondent. No. ED 100946-01 Missouri Court of Appeals, Eastern District, DIVISION ONE. Filed: August 21, 2018 FOR APPELLANT: Eric O. Wolfgram, 462 N. Taylor, 3 rd Floor, St. Louis, MO 63108. FOR RESPONDENT: James G. Nowogrocki, 1015 Locust St., Ste. 400, St. Louis, MO 63101, Kathleen E. Mannion, 4600 Madison Ave., Ste. 810, Kansas City, MO 64112. Before Lisa P. Page, C.J., Robert M. Clayton III, J., and James M. Dowd, J.

ORDER

PER CURIAM.

Sheri Bierman appeals the trial court's judgment dismissing her negligence action against her co-employee, Kimmie Violette, for failure to state a claim upon which relief can be granted. We find no error has occurred.

No jurisprudential purpose would be served by a written opinion. We have, however, provided the parties a memorandum setting forth the reasons for our decision. The judgment of the trial court is affirmed under Rule 84.16(b).
